SEARCH
Module com.reese.mla
Package com.reese.mla

Class Movie

java.lang.Object
com.reese.mla.Movie
public class Movie extends Object
This class creates a Movie Object, of which includes Movie ID, Movie Name, Movie Release Year, Director Name, Composer Name, Movie and Review Score

  • Constructor Details

    • Movie

      public Movie()
      This Constructor is only used if you do not wish to immediately fill in information in the object

    • Movie

      public Movie(int movieID, String movieName, int releaseYear, String director, String composer, double reviewScore)
      USE WITH CAUTION - This is a Constructor that will instantiate with immediate input into the fields of the class. The ' is removed from strings as it interferes with SQL queries. The primary use for the method is when importing from the SQL database. For any other creations of movies please use createMovie().
      Parameters:
      movieID - This is a Unique Integer for identifying this specific movie.
      movieName - This is a String for the name of this Movie.
      releaseYear - This is an Integer for the year this movie was made.
      director - This is a String for the name of the director.
      composer - This is a String for the name of the Composer.
      reviewScore - This is a Double for the review score of this movie.

  • Method Details

    • createMovie

      public void createMovie(String id, String name, String year, String director, String composer, String review)
      This is the safe version of the constructor, so that a user's inputs as strings can be used to create a movie. ID, Year, and Review will be INT, INT, and Double respectively, so
      Parameters:
      id - This is a String that will be a Unique Integer for identifying this specific movie.
      name - This is a String for the name of this Movie.
      year - This is a String that will be an Integer for the year this movie was made.
      director - This is a String for the name of the director.
      composer - This is a String for the name of the Composer.
      review - This is a String that will become a Double for the review score of this movie.

    • getMovieID

      public int getMovieID()
      Returns:
      This movies ID #

    • setMovieID

      public int setMovieID(String stringID)
      Takes a String parameter and converts it to an Int and sets this movies ID if valid
      Parameters:
      stringID - takes the Movies ID as a string that will be converted to an Int.
      Returns:
      Success Status:
      • 0 If Operation was successful,
      • 1 If the ID is invalid input: '<'= 0
      • 2 If its NaN

    • getMovieName

      public String getMovieName()
      Returns:
      Returns this Movie's name

    • setMovieName

      public int setMovieName(String movieNameString)
      This takes a movies name as a String and sets this movies name to the given name. All ' are removed as misc ' can mess up any SQL queries
      Parameters:
      movieNameString - Takes the String that you want to be the movies name.
      Returns:
      Success Status:
    • 0 if successful

    • getReleaseYear

      public int getReleaseYear()
      Returns:
      This movies release year

    • setReleaseYear

      public int setReleaseYear(String stringYear)
      This attempts to set the release year for this Movie
      Parameters:
      stringYear - A String that will be converted to an int for this movies release year
      Returns:
      Success Status:
      • 0 If Operation was successful,
      • 1 If the year is less than 1888
      • 2 If its NaN

    • getDirector

      public String getDirector()
      Returns:
      This movie's director

      Parameters:
      stringDirector - A string that will become this movies director.
      Returns:
      Success Status:
    • 0 if successful

    • getReviewScore

      public double getReviewScore()
      Returns:
      This movies Review Score

    • setReviewScore

      public int setReviewScore(String stringReviewScore)
      Attempts to set this movies review score.
      Parameters:
      stringReviewScore - A string that will be converted to a double.
      Returns:
      Success Status:
      • 0 If Operation was successful,
      • 1 If the Score is too low (invalid input: '<'0.1)
      • 2 If its too high (>10.0)
      • 3 If its NaN

    • movieSearch

      public static int movieSearch(javafx.collections.ObservableList<Movie> list, String movieToSearch)
      This method takes a list and searches either by an ID (passed as a string) or by Movie Name, and returns the Index of the movie
      Parameters:
      list - This is the list to be searched for a specific movie
      movieToSearch - Can be an Int for ID (as a String) or left alone for movie Name Search.
      Returns:
      Movie Index:
      • -1 If movie is not found,
      • Any other integer If Index of Movie is if found

    • calcMovieAvg

      public static String calcMovieAvg(javafx.collections.ObservableList<Movie> list)
      This method takes an ObservableList of type Movie and calculates the average review score of all Movies in the list.
      Parameters:
      list - The Observable list for the review scores to be averaged
      Returns:
      the review score as a string.

    • sortMovieList

      public static void sortMovieList(javafx.collections.ObservableList<Movie> list, Map<String,Boolean> filterValues)
      This Method is what is used to sort the list of movies by all possible metrics
      Parameters:
      list - The list to be sorted
      filterValues - This is a doozy: This is here as the areas this method is called is inside lambdas, but those lambdas do not want to directly affect a boolean so using a map solves this issue. If a solution is known, please solve this!

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Custom toString for a Movie
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string in format of: Movie ID: | Movie Name: | Release Year: | Director: | Composer: | ReviewScore:
